bibl.title: Letter from Oliver L. Pothier to Florence M. Read, August 20, 1923

div1.p: Pothier sends Read his final report on the work of the Yellow Fever Commission that went to Colombia in 1923.

div1.head: Letter from Oliver L. Pothier to Florence M. Read, August 20, 1923
div1.opener:
C O P Y
New Orleans, August 20, 1923.
Miss Florence M. Read,
Assistant Secretary,
International Health Board,
61 Broadway,
New York, N.Y.
Dear Miss Read:
div1.p:
In compliance with your letter of June 21st, 1923, which became mis-
placed in the mass of correspondence which accumulated during my absence, I
am sending, herewith inclosed and appended, my report of the work done by me
in Colombia, including the period from April 11th, 1923, to July 9th, 1923.

I have attached to the report all correspondence and telegrams re-
ceived by me.

The report is addressed to Dr. J. H. White, as head of the commission.
I am sending a copy of this report to Dr. F. F. Russell, as he may want to use
it for reference in conjunction with Dr. H. R. Carter's work.

closer.seg:
P.S.
January 19th, 1924. Since the above has been written, it has been im-
possible for me to complete the report until today, on account of the mass of
detail work that I found unfinished and to be accomplished on my return here.
O.L.P.
